SourcedStatement: Los Angeles and Sacramento counties are the two other most popular California destinations, according to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency.
Name: SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency

SourcedStatement: When asked for comment, the San Francisco mayor’s office said it had not received the letter.
Name: San Francisco mayor’s office

SourcedStatement: Paul Boden, a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project, said the strategy of busing unhoused people out of town dates back to the 1960s, when welfare agencies offered bus tickets to previously institutionalized people in exchange for a signed pledge not to return for a year — a process that was known as “Greyhound therapy.”
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “The aim isn’t to achieve a goal.
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: It’s to get you out of our town, and it’s cheaper than arresting you,” Boden said.
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “The No. 1 answer to homelessness is to make them disappear.
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: Then mayors write letters back and forth: ‘Stop sending your people here.’
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: Then it turns out they’re sending their people here.
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: It shows the ridiculousness of us not trying to address why people are on the streets.”
Name: Paul Boden
Justification: a homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “Our TAP program works really well, and hopefully San Francisco can go back to more — not just dumping — but assisting and actually helping people get help,” Humboldt Supervisor Rex Bohn said at Tuesday’s board meeting.
Name: Rex Bohn
Title: Humboldt Supervisor

SourcedStatement: “We were dismayed to learn that our small, rural county was among the top three destinations in the state where people experiencing homelessness were sent by the program,” states a draft of the letter to San Francisco Mayor London Breed that can be seen on the Humboldt County website.
Name: Humboldt County
Justification: a draft of the letter to San Francisco Mayor London Breed that can be seen on the Humboldt County website

SourcedStatement: “We are concerned that providing bus tickets to other jurisdictions without verifying access to housing, family support or employment does not alleviate homelessness; it simply shifts the person to another county,” Humboldt’s letter says.
Name: Humboldt County

SourcedStatement: “We urge you to ensure that Journey Home participants have the support they need to obtain housing and employment before they receive transportation assistance to Humboldt County.
Name: Humboldt County

SourcedStatement: Let’s act together in partnership to alleviate homelessness throughout our state.”
Name: Humboldt County
